items.title: In Hamburg, a New Musical Landmark for a City With Plans
items.abstract: “A light tower for this city-in-progress,” after years of delays and a tenfold increase in costs.

items.title: A Longtime Artist Reimagines City Landmarks
items.abstract: Cynthia Karalla almost fell into the Central Park Lake and was pierced by brambles to create works for a luxury condominium building — the biggest payday she has ever seen.

items.title: New York City’s Landmarks Law at 50
items.abstract: New construction is needed, the best of the past must be preserved, and the resulting conflicts and debates are unavoidable.

items.title: A Mexico City Design Landmark, Reborn as Something Else
items.abstract: Tucked along a lake in Chapultepec Park, the modernist building is now home to LagoAlgo, a food and art space that defies easy categorization.

items.title: In the Village, Another Piece of the City’s History Is Coming Down
items.abstract: Like other vulnerable landmarks across the city, the house at 14 Gay Street — which helped inspire the musical “Wonderful Town” — is being demolished.
